tit.cmt: 対訳欄のローマ字は「しげとし」となっていますが、「これとし」のようです。

sen.j: 桜山 茲俊（さくらやま これとし、生年不詳 - 元弘2年1月21日 (旧暦)（1332年2月17日））は鎌倉時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Koretoshi SAKURAYAMA (year of birth unknown, died on February 25, 1332) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived in the end Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 元弘2年1月21日は西暦1332年2月25日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Koretoshi SAKURAYAMA (year of birth unknown, died on February 25, 1332) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived in the end Kamakura period.
Koretoshi SAKURAYAMA (year of birth unknown, died on February 25, 1332) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived in the end Kamakura period.

sen.j: 元弘の乱の際、楠木正成の挙兵に呼応する形で備後国一ノ宮にて挙兵した。
sen.e: During the Genko War, he responded to Masashige KUSUNOKI who took up arms and he too took up arms in Ichinomiya, Bingo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Masashige KUSUNOKI raised an army during the Genko War, and Koretoshi kept up with Masashige to take up arms himself in Ichinomiya, Bingo Province.
sen.cmt: 「run-on sentence」と考えられます。「呼応」の訳を「responded」としていますが、実際にやりとりがあっての対応かがわからないため、その意味を持たない訳にしました。
sen.e: Masashige KUSUNOKI raised an army during the Genko War, and Koretoshi kept up with Masashige to take up arms himself in Ichinomiya, Bingo Province.

sen.j: 一時破竹の勢いを示すも、笠置山の戦いにおける官軍敗戦の報に部下は四散し、桜山軍は弱体化。
sen.e: Although his army swept all before it at one point, his soldiers lost morale on hearing the news of the defeat of the Imperial army in the battle of Mt. Kasagi, and the Sakurayama's army was weakened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At one point, his troops showed superiority that no enemy could withstand against them, although once his troops heard the news about the defeat of the Imperial army in the battle of Mt. Kasagi, Sakurayama troops scattered and eventually the troops were weakened.
sen.cmt: 直訳的でしたので語順の変更、繰り返し語の変更などを行ないました。
sen.e: At one point, his troops showed superiority that no enemy could withstand against them, although once his troops heard the news about the defeat of the Imperial army in the battle of Mt. Kasagi, Sakurayama troops scattered and eventually the troops were weakened.

sen.j: 吉備津宮で妻子を殺害後、一族郎党と共に自刃した。
sen.e: After killing his wife and children at the Kibitsu no miya, he committed suicide along with his families and retainers.
